definitions.definition: To take a long position in.
Having much distance from one terminating point on an object or an area to another terminating point (usually applies to horizontal dimensions; see Usage Notes below).
definitions.example: It's a long way from the Earth to the Moon.
The pyramids of Egypt have been around for a long time.

definitions.definition: Seemingly lasting a lot of time, because it is boring or tedious or tiring.
Possessing or owning stocks, bonds, commodities or other financial instruments with the aim of benefiting of the expected rise in their value.
definitions.example: I'm long in DuPont;  I have a long position in DuPont.

definitions.definition: Of a fielding position, close to the boundary (or closer to the boundary than the equivalent short position).
(of a ball or a shot) Landing beyond the baseline, and therefore deemed to be out.
Occurring or coming after an extended interval; distant in time; far away.
Over a great distance in space.

definitions.example: How long is it until the next bus arrives?
Paris has long been considered one of the most cultured cities in the world.

definitions.definition: To await, aspire, desire greatly (something to occur or to be true)
definitions.example: She longed for him to come back.

definitions.definition: To be appropriate to, to pertain or belong to.
